title: How Publisher Rocket Can Help New Authors find the best categories and best keywords - 2024

tactics.name: Keyword Research with Publisher Rocket
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to analyze keywords for competition and search volume, prioritizing lower competition and reasonable search numbers for new authors.
steps: Input keywords into Publisher Rocket's keyword search tool
Filter results by competitive score and search volume
Compare keywords across ebook, paperback, and hardcover categories
caveats: Tool may not account for seasonal trends

tactics.name: Keyword Search Strategy
tactics.description: Identify low-competition keywords with reasonable search volume by exploring category hierarchies (oceans/ponds) and testing variations like 'police procedural series'.
steps: Search broad categories (e.g., mystery thriller) to identify subcategories (ponds)
Filter for keywords with <100 searches but <50000 BSR rank
Test variations like 'police procedural series' vs 'police procedural books'
Separate ebook/physical format targeting (e.g., 'books' for physical, 'ebooks' for digital)
caveats: Avoid overly specific niches like 'Scottish police procedural' unless targeting niche markets
source_quotes: 'police procedural Mysteries series and it has under a 100 searches'

tactics.name: Analyze Category Sales Trends
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket's Competition Analyzer to track category sales performance and identify slumps or growth trends.
steps: Check bestseller lists for category fit
Compare individual sales performance to market trends
Monitor seasonal fluctuations in category demand
caveats: Seasonal trends may skew data during holidays or vacations
source_quotes: if this is where they're going to come to find their next book then this would be a category that you would want to list in

tactics.name: Identify Selectable Categories
tactics.description: Determine which Amazon categories are selectable for your book using Publisher Rocket's category search tool.
steps: Check for selectable vs non-selectable categories
Prioritize categories with viable sales potential
caveats: Some categories may have restricted selection options
source_quotes: this is very valuable information because you might find this category under someone else's book and then be looking for it and you can't find it

tactics.name: Category & Keyword Research
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to analyze Kindle categories and AMS keywords for book discovery
steps: Export CSV data from keyword searches
Compare similar books in the same category
source_quotes: you would go down and find all of the categories that would be good for you

heuristics.name: Competitive Score Prioritization
heuristics.condition: If competitive score is below 50,000, prioritize the keyword
source_quotes: "lower competition is better for new authors"

heuristics.name: Low Competition Boost
heuristics.condition: If keyword has <100 searches and <50000 BSR rank, prioritize for ebook formats
source_quotes: 'books that range in that uh in that search they make about $146 a month'

heuristics.name: Boost Low-Competition Niches
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200 and BSR exceeds 50,000, prioritize niche categories
source_quotes: if your sales are doing good and then all of a sudden they slump a little bit you can come here and find out is it me personally or is it just uh overall a slump in sales

heuristics.name: Review Count Filter
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize titles
source_quotes: make sure they are books that are very similar to you

claims.statement: Publishing in multiple formats (ebook, paperback, hardcover) allows books to be listed in nine categories across Amazon.
source_quotes: "you can have the book presented in nine categories"

claims.statement: KDP prohibits using 'free' in keywords but allows 'books' for physical format targeting
source_quotes: 'free books I don't believe they allow you to use the word free in your keywords'

claims.statement: Amazon categories have both selectable and non-selectable options for book listings
source_quotes: this is very valuable information because you might find this category under someone else's book and then be looking for it and you can't find it

claims.statement: Kindle Unlimited is controversial but helpful for beginners
source_quotes: Kindle unlimited is very good for a beginner

niche_patterns.example: mystery thrillers + police procedurals + urban crime
niche_patterns.description: Drill down from broad categories to specific niches with lower competition
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Targets underserved audiences while maintaining discoverability
source_quotes: "drill all the way down to a final category like police procedurals"

niche_patterns.description: Target specific subcategories with format preferences and regional relevance to avoid niche-specific competition
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Balances search volume with competition levels while aligning with reader preferences
source_quotes: 'I would stay away from that because very often the people that read British... books they're not as interested in American stories'

niche_patterns.description: Target specific reader demographics with unique constraints
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Creates focused market segments with defined search behaviors
source_quotes: will your readers be hanging out here is this where they are going to come to find their next book
